lines.text: Life is not a whipped-cream cake, Pelikán.
All I can say, Comrade Pelikán, is that the international situation is intensifying.
But just remember this, Comrade Pelikán. The class struggle is intensifying.
That's a new skirt, isnt't it?
It is, Comrade Virág.
It's too short. Leave the sexuality to be the opium of the declining Western.

As of today, the ghost train shall be know as The Socialist Ghost Train. We'll get rid of the skeletons and other old junk. We'll replace them with portraits of our great leaders, especially Comrade Bástya.
What's this?
An orange.
An orange?
The new Hungarian orange. It's slightly yellower, it's slightly sharper, but our own.
The international situation is intensifying. We've caught up with the latest group of inner parasites.
I feel a bit bad about it, though. Why do we have to make such a fuss over it? We deceived the people after all.
let there be a Hungarian orange! And there it was! We made no empty promises, Pelikán!
Is it possible that I'm a spy?
Everything's possible.
I met Zoltán Dániel in 1942. I didn't yet suspect at that time...
What didn't you suspect?
That I would meet frogmen.
Back again?
Shut up. The regime can thrive without me, too.
Not for long.
Why?
The Americans are coming.
Truman on a white horse? Don't you know anything new?
Mercy, I'm a complete idiot.
The suspicious thing about them is that they're not suspicious.
those who don't trust us, don't trust themselves and those who don't trust us don't trust our bright future, either. And those who don't trust our happy, bright future... are traitors.
Confidential upper orders. Vigilance comes first.

[upon seeing his newly built house]
Comrade Virág! No doors? No windows?

[after reading the testimony of Pelikán]
What's this? People don't even want to murder Comrade Bástya anymore? I'm worth shit nowadays?
The previous trial... I didn't want to repeat myself. But I'll correct it. After our wise leader, Comrade Bástya was to be murdered.
We sacrifice our entire lives for you people, but you don't deserve us, you heartless rabble.
